headline: Aluminum Tariffs Remain Key Issue in U.S-Canada Talks
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Thursday that U.S. trade talks with Canada have involved aluminum tariffs as some U.S. manufacturers, most notably Ford Motor, deal with financial hits from the levy.  During an appearance on CNBC, Bessent addressed complaints from companies such as Ford about how U.S. tariffs are harming their bottom lines.  Ford said earlier this week that it paid out over $800 million in tariffs last quarter despite manufacturing most of its vehicles in the U.S.

raw.headline: Aluminum Tariffs Remain Key Issue in U.S-Canada Talks

During an appearance on CNBC, Bessent addressed complaints from companies such as Ford about how U.S. tariffs are harming their bottom lines.  Ford said earlier this week that it paid out over $800 million in tariffs last quarter despite manufacturing most of its vehicles in the U.S.

summary: Ford Motor Company (NYSE:F) shares are trading higher on Thursday after the automaker posted second-quarter results that exceeded Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, driven by solid vehicle volumes and favorable pricing trends. Ford reported second-quarter revenue of $46.94 billion, beating the consensus estimate of $42.77 billion, according to Benzinga Pro. headline: U.S.-Canada Trade Talks Dealing With Aluminum-Tariff Levels, Bessent Says
summary: U.S. trade talks with Canada have involved the level of aluminum tariffs as some U.S. manufacturers, most notably  Ford Motor  are dealing with a financial hit, according to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.  The Treasury secretary’s remarks Thursday signal possible relief for Canada’s aluminum sector, which—along with steel makers—faces a 50% tariff on products entering the U.S. Canada is the U.S.’s biggest foreign supplier of both metals, and the deals President Trump has made to date have maintained the 50% duty of steel and aluminum.  The U.S. and Canada are in talks on a deal to resolve the tariff row ahead of Friday’s deadline.

raw.headline: U.S.-Canada Trade Talks Dealing With Aluminum-Tariff Levels, Bessent Says
raw.summary: U.S. trade talks with Canada have involved the level of aluminum tariffs as some U.S. manufacturers, most notably  Ford Motor  are dealing with a financial hit, according to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.  The Treasury secretary’s remarks Thursday signal possible relief for Canada’s aluminum sector, which—along with steel makers—faces a 50% tariff on products entering the U.S. Canada is the U.S.’s biggest foreign supplier of both metals, and the deals President Trump has made to date have maintained the 50% duty of steel and aluminum.  The U.S. and Canada are in talks on a deal to resolve the tariff row ahead of Friday’s deadline.

headline: UK Export Finance guarantees 1 billion pound loan to Ford UK
summary: A British government agency is providing a 1 billion pound export development guarantee to the UK arm of U.S. carmaker Ford, supporting the company's long-term growth targets around the world. "This £1 billion loan guarantee is a major boost for Britain's auto sector. It will help develop world-leading products, open new export markets, and secure jobs," finance minister Rachel Reeves said in the statement released by UK Export Finance (UKEF).

raw.headline: UK Export Finance guarantees 1 billion pound loan to Ford UK

It will help develop world-leading products, open new export markets, and secure jobs," finance minister Rachel Reeves said in the statement released by UK Export Finance (UKEF).

headline: Robert Paganini Named Campus President of UTI-Bloomfield
summary: Universal Technical Institute (UTI), the transportation, skilled trades, electrical, and energy division of Universal Technical Institute, Inc., today announced that Robert ("Rob") Paganini has been named Campus President of UTI-Bloomfield. A seasoned executive in automotive and diesel education, Paganini has spent years helping students build careers across the skilled trades, including at the UTI-Miramar campus in Florida.

headline: India's Tata Motors to raise 1 billion euros in equity for Iveco deal
summary: NEW DELHI (Reuters) -Tata Motors plans to raise about 1 billion euros ($1.14 billion) of equity to repay the loan funding its $4.5 billion offer to buy Iveco's trucks and bus business, the Indian automaker's chief financial officer said on Thursday.  Tata and Iveco announced an all-cash deal on Wednesday.  It will be the biggest ever transaction for the Mumbai-based automaker, which made its last major acquisition in 2008 when it bought Jaguar Land Rover from Ford Motor for $2.3 billion.

Tata and Iveco announced an all-cash deal on Wednesday.  It will be the biggest ever transaction for the Mumbai-based automaker, which made its last major acquisition in 2008 when it bought Jaguar Land Rover from Ford Motor for $2.3 billion.
